intro: Elleanthus weberbauerianus, commonly known as the Weberbauer's elleanthus, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in regions of Peru and Bolivia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and typically includes species with medicinal properties. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in high-altitude grasslands and shrublands, thriving in temperate to cold climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
